intro: Chenopodium anidiophyllum, commonly known as desert goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are often surrounded by bracts. Its seeds are small and dry, adapted for dispersal by wind, and it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils. Chenopodium anidiophyllum is also known for its edible leaves, which have a slightly tart flavor and are used in traditional cuisines.
